quotes.quote: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: There are few nudities so objectionable as the naked truth.
quotes.author: Agnes Repplier

quotes.quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: Ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.quote: Chase after truth like hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat-tails.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: It's a basic truth of the human condition that everybody lies. The only variable is about what. The weird thing about telling someone they're dying is it tends to focus their priorities. You find out what matters to them. What they're willing to die for. What they're willing to lie for.
quotes.author: David Shore

quotes.quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.
quotes.author: Edith Sitwell

quotes.quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand on.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quotes.quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: The truth that makes men free is for the most part the truth which men prefer not to hear.
quotes.author: Herbert Agar

quotes.quote: As scarce as truth is, the supply has always been in excess of the demand.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Do not run from the truth. There be nought so hard to live with as a lie.
quotes.author: Lenin

quotes.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A lie can travel halfway around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The history of our race, and each individual's experience, are sown thick with evidence that a truth is not hard to kill and that a lie told well is immortal.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Truth is more of a stranger than fiction.
quotes.author: Matthew Arnold

quotes.quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
quotes.author: Niels Bohr

quotes.quote: The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
quotes.author: Quintus Septimius Tertullianus

quotes.quote: Truth persuades by teaching, but does not teach by persuading.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: I have been truthful all along the way. The truth is more interesting, and if you tell the truth you never have to cover your tracks.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: I guess sometimes you have to lie to find the truth.
quotes.author: Scott Westerfeld

quotes.quote: Turns out if you never lie, there's always someone mad at you.
quotes.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: How often have I said to you that when you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth?
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened.
